Row.Text: The Hogskola is a Medieval-era building unique to Sweden, replacing the University. It increases the [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output of the city, and it's even more effective if the city is near to jungle or tundra tiles. Unlike the University, Hogskola costs no gold maintenance. The city must already have a Library in order to construct a Hogskola.

The city must already have a Library in order to construct a Hogskola.

The city must already have a Library in order to construct a Hogskola.

Requires no [ICON_GOLD] Gold maintenance.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Jungle tiles and +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Tundra tiles worked by this City. Costs no [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have a Library.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]Requires no [ICON_GOLD] Gold maintenance.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Jungle tiles and +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Tundra tiles worked by this City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have a Library.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR]Requires no [ICON_GOLD] Gold maintenance.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Jungle tiles and +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Tundra tiles worked by this City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have a Library.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Source: Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/University_college_(Scandinavia))[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A Hogskola in Denmark, Norway and Sweden is an independent institution that provides tertiary education (Bachelor and Master's Degrees) and quaternary education (PhD). These institutions traditionally had emphasis on less academic and more vocational programmes such as teacher or nursing education as well as shorter technical education. In Sweden, education is funded by tax money. This goes for both primary and secondary schools, high schools and universities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Credits: Swedish Hogskola - Gazebo, mikeburnfire[ENDCOLOR]
